task_summary: Detect the blue bottle, approach and grasp it with a standard side grasp, then maintain a stable hold for a short duration.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene with multiple colored containers is manipulated by a robotic arm. The goal is to hold the blue bottle located on the right side of the table. The robot first perceives the target, prepares by opening the gripper, aligns to the bottle for a side grasp, executes the pick, and then holds the object for a fixed duration to demonstrate a stable grasp. Movements are conservative and precise to avoid disturbing nearby items.
preconditions: Table and objects are reachable by the arm
Blue bottle is present and visible
stepwise_plan: Detect the blue bottle on the table
Open the gripper to a safe width
Approach and align to the bottle with tight tolerance
Pick the bottle using a standard side grasp
Hold the bottle steadily for a short duration
success_criteria: Object remains in gripper during the hold window
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-run perception or adjust viewpoint
If alignment times out, retreat slightly and retry approach
If grasp slips, reopen, realign, and reattempt pick
task_long_description.termination: End after the hold duration completes successfully or upon unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: Arm is closely aligned near the right-side blue object, indicating imminent grasp.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp action likely follows with gripper closure and lift/hold.

node_specs.description: Locate and confirm visibility of the blue bottle.
Approach and align end-effector precisely to the bottle.
Execute a standard side grasp to lift the bottle.
Maintain a steady hold of the grasped bottle.

failure_modes: Blue bottle not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Collision with adjacent objects during approach
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection or slight viewpoint change
Retreat and retry alignment with same tolerance
Reopen gripper and retry pick with identical grasp key
Abort if repeated collisions are detected
assumptions: Rightmost blue cylindrical container is treated as 'blue_bottle' even if it visually resembles a can.
Side grasp is feasible given object geometry and surrounding clearance.

expected_success_criteria: ObjectInGripper would be true after Pick (implicit check by successful HoldObject).
No timeout occurs during approach and pick.
